1.title: The Brothers Witzig
1.plot: Australian brothers Paul and John Witzig were two of the original surf media pioneers, bringing surf culture to a broader youth audience. In the late '60s and '70s, their films and publications popularized both the sport and the ethos of surfing.

2.title: The Cooly Kids
2.plot: The wild and competitive surfers of tiny Coolangatta, Australia push each other to perfect their ride and rack up wins on the international pro circuit. Two generations of Cooly Kids discuss their hometown's surf tradition and its unique waves.

3.title: Lance's Right (and Left)
3.plot: With just a map and a hunch, Lance Knight sought the perfect surf break in the extremely remote Mentawai Islands, discovering the wave that bears his name. Now a popular destination for the world's surfers, Lance retraces the journey with his sons.

4.title: Bob Hurley
4.plot: Bob Hurley's meteoric rise as the creator of one of the biggest surf brands in the world is a testament to the American dream. From his start as a respected shaper, he built his company on a love of surfing and a belief in himself to beat the odds.

imdb.plot outline: Like the proverbial pebble thrown into still water, some surfers have influences so profound they ripple across oceans and through time to shape surfing for decades to come. These pioneers forever changed how the world sees and experiences surfing.
imdb.title: The Ripple Effect: Shorts
plot: Like the proverbial pebble thrown into still water, some surfers have influences so profound they ripple across oceans and through time to shape surfing for decades to come. These pioneers forever changed how the world sees and experiences surfing.
